ModuleTitle: Approaches to Clinical Signs and Symptoms(Paediatrics)
Department: Nursing/Alice Lee Ctr For Nursing Stud
ModuleDescription: This module emphasis on clinical approaches for the common clinical symptoms, signs and abnormal laboratory results. Students can utilise the knowledge and skills learnt from advanced health assessment and pathophysiology to identify the common causes of the presented clinical problems, as well as to recognise the “red flag” during the evaluation and initiate the appropriate immediate investigations and specific managements.
Prerequisite: NUR5601 Advanced Health Assessment (Paediatrics) NUR5602 Applied Pathophysiology (Paediatrics)
